entry.title: Add missing messages to the HostControlDispatcher handler
entry.content:
While working on the host I occasionally see "Unknown control

message received" in the log file. I would like to know which

control message was received but it's not simple since the

ControlMessage contains a dozen or so optional fields and does

not use oneof.



I've added some logging statements to the if tree for the current

set of ControlMessages. The unhandled messages will log out which

message they are or 'unknown' in case we add a new message to the

proto w/o adding it to the HostControlDispatcher.



Change-Id: Iaacc14e84b5e9f6d192cf614015739818714307a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5368320

Commit-Queue: Yuwei Huang

entry.content:
This reverts commit 247d60cd077eef87e7b71b24022c3885bde648a0.



Reason for revert: Spike in crashes in AndroidWebView https://g-issues.chromium.org/issues/328348303. Investigation is also pretty much concluded for NotifyScriptLoaded so there is no need to keep this in the code.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Blink.NotifyScriptLoaded.TabSearch]=Investigation completed, no longer needed.



Bug: 328348303, 41492614



Original change's description:

> Reland "Record WebUI NotifyScriptLoaded initialization time."

>

> This is a reland of commit 837bd7343ed45f95816a0e6728216bc22f6cd219

> Revert was caused by a crash where fetching url led to a seg fault.

>

> Changes have been made to validate that we are not in a detached state and that the Url is available.

>

> Original change's description:

> > Record WebUI NotifyScriptLoaded initialization time.

> >

> > Purpose of the metric is to investigate WebUI start up time in P99 scenarios. This CL specifically targets the time the renderer takes in `HTMLDocumentParser::NotifyScriptLoaded` when launching a TabSearch WebUI. entry.title: cros: Install notification limit
entry.content:
Notifications are unbounded, users can have as many as their machine

can store. We have an OOM issue with chromebooks which is a bit hard

to root-cause.



There are reports of some users having 118MB of notifications

(and in some extremes, up to 1GB) stored. Install a limit on the client

to prevent this.



It's possible the users are getting sent a large amount by unruly

extensions, it's also possible they are getting sent massive

images repeatedly. This basic limit of 75 notifications should prevent

most of these OOMs. This will be rolled out via finch to see if we have

a reduction in OOMs across crOS.



Bug: b:315373019

Change-Id: I8149d8aaff9d1e47b66a1b91ddf8f23b43b89274

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277462

Reviewed-by: Ahmed Mehfooz

Commit-Queue: Alex Newcomer

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272401}

entry.content:
This CL changes `MultipartUploadRequestFactory` into

`ConnectorUploadRequestFactory` and updates relevant code to use it

adequately. This is done in preparation of further implementation of

`ResumableUploadRequest` which will require classes like

`CloudBinaryUploadService` to treat both types of requests abstractly as

`ConnectorUploadRequest`s.

entry.title: [extended-updates] Extended Updates settings scaffolding
entry.content:
This change updates the settings row in the About page where the

update status message is, to show the option to opt into extended

updates to the user. The visibility is controlled by a variable

on the page element. There is initial logic around the variable,

which is defaulted to false.

The UI and text are temporary and have not been finalized by UX.

The new UI elements are not visible, and are only visible in testing.

entry.title: [Interop] Add TestDriver support for get_computed_label and get_computed_role
entry.content:
Implement the TestDriver APIs get_computed_label and get_computed_role

as specified at [1] and [2].



These are needed for the accname tests in the Interop2024 Accessibility

focus area [3].



These APIs were added to WPT in [4] and are already supported in

WebDriver. Implementing them on window.internals allows us to run

these tests in the normal Chromium test environment, which will help

us in getting the tests passing for Interop2024.



[1] https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/#get-computed-label

[2] https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/#get-computed-role

[3] https://wpt.fyi/results/accname?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&view=interop&q=label%3Ainterop-2024-accessibility

[4] https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/commit/790bb1a2ce2d99442f2e72054dd090a4b5b9c29c



Bug: 325612090, 41490722

Change-Id: I4d6899a97f1ed26a26b4e3b2e07ef2eb9e6e4b96

entry.title: Add support for auto keyword in CSS calc-size().
entry.content:
This adds support for the auto keyword in calc-size() by adding the

small changes needed through the whole pipeline: parsing, storage, and

layout. The layout change here is only a single change to activate the

changes in the dependent CLs.



This adds a number of tests for auto. The existing tests for animation

from a neutral keyframe to calc-size(auto, size) do not yet work, but

animation between calc-size(auto, ...) values works (as shown by the new

tests).

entry.title: Move static part of upload preparation.
entry.content:
Part of the upload requests that never change are moved to the client,

so that they don't need to be kept together with each cached upload.

at a later time, if necessary.

entry.title: [Gamepad] Replace std::unique_ptr<T[]> in RawInputGamepadDevice
entry.content:
This CL replaces occurrences of std::unique_ptr with

base::HeapArray. Using std::unique_ptr does not automatically

preserve the size of the allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc

bounds checks, leading to bugs which attackers use to compromise our

users.

entry.title: [reland] pa: couple of tweaks based on Speedometer
entry.content:
I believe the reason for the crashes is that when

shrinking the ring buffer size (AdjustForBackground), I

wasn't adjusting global_empty_slot_span_ring_index. This

meant that if global_empty_slot_span_ring_index was >

kMinFreeableSpans, a slot-span could end up being assigned

an index beyond the ring buffer size. This is because

SlotSpanMetadata::RegisterEmpty increments

global_empty_slot_span_ring_index based on the current index and

global_empty_slot_span_ring_size:



https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/dawn/third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/third_party/angle/third_party/dawn/third_party/partition_alloc/src/partition_alloc/partition_page.cc;l=115-116;drc=4b0447a323de1a925d2b08127e256ef735d73fc3



Also, in this version the features are all disabled. I'll enable

via field trial.



Original description:



Calling to madvise/mprotect is expensive on macs. This patch aims

to reduce the number of such calls. It adds the following:

. Increases empty cache index bits by 8.

. If RegisterEmpty() is called and the slot span was already

registered, don't do anything. This is in hopes of avoiding

churn if a slot-span is reused a bunch.

. Increases max_empty_slot_spans_dirty_bytes_shift by a factor of 2.

. Adds feature for that makes blink's partition for buffers use the

large empty slot span ring.



Bug: 329199197

Change-Id: I819ba2ba82bbed83cba40d7561f21f4aa19ff088

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5362719

Reviewed-by: John Abd-El-Malek

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Benoit Lize

entry.title: Determine ratio of Scroll stages to VSyncs
entry.content:
OnBeginFrame signals from Viz to CC race with the Browser sending Input

to CC. This can lead to inconsistent number of input events per frame

while scrolling. As InputHandlerProxy::DeliverInputForBeginFrame can be

triggered while the input queue is empty. With the input arriving in

InputHandlerProxy::HandleInputEventWithLatencyInfo afterwards.



We want to determine the distribution of when input arrives in the

Renderer vs the VSync times. So we can experiment with waiting for

input when the queue is empty. We also want to determine the

distribution of event generation times to judge thresholds to not

pause waiting for.



Bug: 40132248

Change-Id: Ia151ed3390fa9226923019aebfacb46f6c18ace2

entry.title: Update active-map usage in CRD
entry.content:
This CL fixes a few issues we had in our active_map impl.



The first is that we were calling GET_ACTIVEMAP for each frame

but that call is not needed and is likely just there for testing

purposes (the VPX/AOM headers do not describe the usage for it

but I confirmed with the AOM team it's not needed).



The second is pretty minor but instead of creating a new

{aom|vpx}_active_map_t for each frame, I made it a class member.



Lastly, we can skip setting an active map for keyframes but we

still clear it so it's ready for the next frame.

entry.title: WPT: Script child removal does not trigger execution
entry.content:
Given the old Chromium change that introduced this behavior:

- https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/604e798ec6ee30f44d57a5c4a44ce3dab3a871ed



... the old discussion in:

- https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/732#pullrequestreview-328249015

- https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/4354#issuecomment-476038918



... and the much newer discussion in:

- https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1261

- https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10188



This CL upstreams an old test ensuring that removal of a child node

from a script node that has not "already started" [1], does not trigger

script execution. Only the *insertion* of child nodes (to a

non-already-started script node) should trigger that script's execution.



[1]: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/C#already-started



R=nrosenthal@chromium.org



Bug: 40150299

entry.title: [blink-a11y]: ensure RenderAccessibilityImpl always gets mode changes first
entry.content:
Currently, RenderAccessibilityImpl is an observer of RenderFrameImpl

and reacts to AccessibilitymodeChanged to set up or tear down Blink

accessibility.



This is a problem because, depending on when the observers are added,

RenderAccessibilityImpl may be the *last* observer called. In those

cases, previous observers e.g. PdfAccessibilityTree, may inaccurately

conclude that accessibility isn't on when it *is*, or not have access to

state that should be there e.g. WebAXObjects.



Fix this by making the direct mode changed call from

RenderAccessibilityManager -> RenderAccessibilityImpl (which it owns

anyway).



We also re-enable some PDF a11y tests. These tests were flakey and more

recently, consistently failing after the work in

go/chrome-pdf-a11y-stabilization. It is likely for both cases, this

change found and fixed the root cause of the once flakes now

fails.



R=aleventhal@chromium.org



Bug: 327458821

Test: cq

entry.title: [Private Network Access] Get client IP address space from the service worker that loads the main document
entry.content:
This is to fix https://github.com/WICG/private-network-access/issues/126



The issue is that when the main document is fetched by a service worker,

the URLResponseHead's remote_endpoint doesn't have an IP address, which

makes sense because the service worker doesn't always have to forward

the fetch to an actual network fetch. This results in the render frame

host and the loaders it created having kUnknown IP address space, which

in turn causes the Private Network Access policy to be allow [1].



Also even if the service worker did fetch from file scheme, the service

worker can still modify the content, so the client address space

shouldn't be local, otherwise a public service worker can bypass PNA.



This CL stores the service worker version's IP address space in the

URLResponseHead of the document (main resource) it loads, and then use

that to calculate the document's IP address space.



[1]

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/private_network_access_util.cc;l=113-117;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090



Bug: 40241368,323583084

Change-Id: I8751e52cb5e1faa8394531c90d68664e8bd641e8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5308035

Auto-Submit: Jonathan Hao

Commit-Queue: Jonathan Hao

entry.title: [reland]pine: Set a threshold for taking the pine image
entry.content:
This is the reland of crrev.com/c/5347636 with the fixing of the

tests failure.



Set a threshold for taking the pine image. If the time duration to

take the pine image exceeds this threshold, the shutdown process will

be triggered immediately without the pine image. This is done to

guarantee that the shutdown process will not be blocked too long to

be noticed by the users.

entry.title: [CodeHealth] std::unique_ptr<T[]> -> HeapArray in color_correction_test_utils.cc
entry.content:
This CL replaces the use of std::unique_ptr with the use of

HeapArray in color_correction_test_utils.cc



Using std::unique_ptr does not automatically preserve the

size of the allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc bounds

checks, leading to bugs which attackers use to compromise our users.



This CL is a part of a code health rotation effort to eliminate

the usage of std::unique_ptr.



More details in the one-pager:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YsPR8GoN8VTP1ABKCISaQkuBif1Cn80cTxTjsM8QT4s/edit?resourcekey=0-3qKCKgDwFwwjS7KI5XAcBQ&tab=t.0



Bug: 326458659, 326459373, 326458840, 326459217, 40285824

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Move ReadWriteCardsManagerImpl initialization
entry.content:
Move the initialization of ReadWriteCardsManager from PostProfileInit to

PreProfileInit to address the dependency issue for the OsSettingsManager

which is created right after user logs and user profile is ready.



SearchSection which is owned by the OsSettingsManager always assumes

that the QuickAnswerController owned by the ReadWriteCardsManager is

always created before itself. Thus moving the initialization of

ReadWriteCardsManager to the PreProfileInit to ensure.

entry.title: [text-box-trim] Handle when the last child is empty
entry.content:
This patch handles when `text-box-trim: end` but the last

child was empty, by retrying the layout.



Note that this patch handles only whether to trim or not. The

actual amount to trim should be implemented in

`InlineLayoutAlgorithm` in future patches. More code changes

will be needed when `InlineLayoutAlgorithm` makes progress.

entry.title: Reset PlusAddressHttpClient on sign out.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the following edge case could occur:

- The user would send a request to the plus address server.

- The user would sign out (and/or sign in with a different account).

- The request would complete and be processed by the new user.



This CL resets all network requests on sign out. A follow-up CL will

add a mechanism to make sure that callbacks from the thus cancelled

requests are still run with a "kSignoutError".



Bug: 323731009

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: handle broken NALU type
entry.content:
Reports from the field show that the CHECK for known NALU type

is being hit, which means it's a(n unsigned) value beyond the

known ones. Originally the code assumed that H264Parser would

not allow this to happen but closer inspection of that class

shows that there is no particular check on the bitstream

data [1], so it could have any 5-bit number.



This CL simply changes the code to not crash but return error

if a broken NALU type is returned.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/h264_parser.cc;l=536;drc=644874afbd6aa7c5de82636ad52d6b298c34a458?q=AdvanceToNextNALU



Bug: b:324478176

Change-Id: I34425e6c777f9ec42d62f95a75faaf25f4f1d395

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5369572

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

entry.title: Reland "Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 49599d86419c742d12d118e12bf30b79f64c69b0



Original change's description:

> Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts

>

> While moving ByteSwap() callers, I found the DTS code doing byte swaps

> by casting byte spans to uint16_t spans, which causes UB if they are

> not aligned. The function explicitly handles non-16-bit aligned inputs

> earlier, so clearly it's expected and we should not CHECK on the

> alignment. So instead, change the code to work with bytes and do the

> swaps in a for loop.

>

> While here, make use of the new split_at() to split the output span

> up into disjoint subspans that are each written to.

>

> R=dalecurtis@chromium.org

>

> Bug: 40284755

> Change-Id: I11c557fd3e0f6fd64555b299f3492ca7722aeae2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366084

> Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

> Owners-Override: danakj

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271821}



Bug: 40284755

Change-Id: I6a067c0bee14898006163a5706bff5e9947843f7

entry.title: Migrating code from base::ByteSwap and friends to byte conversions
entry.content:
ByteSwap + memcpy (or similar via iterators) can be spelt more clearly

with the new base::numerics byte conversions to convert to and from

byte arrays of big/little endian.



Some code uses BigEndianReader + ByteSwap to read little endian

buffers! Introduce SpanReader to provide a simple api around reading

off the front of the span dynamically in place of using many nested

split_at() calls.



SpanReader overlaps with BufferIterator in some ways, but it provides

a more ergonomic API for reading off spans (including fixed size

spans) and dealing with running out of room explicitly, like

BigEndianReader did. And it does not introduce the complexity of

worrying about seeking or truncating to users of the API.



Bug: 40284755

entry.title: [MappableSI] Make ExoTestHelper methods static.
entry.content:
1. Make ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer and

ExoTestHelper::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer static as it does not use any

class members. Update all relevant uses.



2. Remove ExoTestHelper::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer usage as its no longer

needed after converting tests to use ::CreateBuffer instead.



3. Add a new method ExoTestHelper::CreateBufferFromGMBHandle() to allow

tests to continue using GMBs for Map()/Unmap() for now. Later these

tests will be converted to use mappableSI directly.



4. Update Buffer::CreateBuffer to take is_overlay_candidate as an

additional params which some tests requires.



5. Update ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer to take is_overlay_candidate as an

additional param required by some tests.



6. Convert tests to use ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer instead of using

::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer.

entry.title: CertProvisioning: Call result callback asynchronously
entry.content:
Call the result callback asynchronously in CertProvisioningWorkers.

The workers might be deleted in the callback while something is

still interacting with them in the current call stack.



Also update the unit tests to wait for the result instead of just

observing the calls, so the tests don’t have to rely on

RunUntilIdle after this CL.
